name: Pranav Gujarathi
aboutText:
Hello! I am a Data Science Grad student. I completed B.Tech in Electrical Engineering in 2018.
 Strong Machine Learning conceptual as well as practical skills.

I am driven by challenging, fast-paced, exciting, and educational environments. My areas of interest include end-to-end sustainable, efficient and robust AI solutions.

experience.name: ZS Associates
experience.description:
•Thoroughly analyzed marketing data for healthcare companies, primarily utilizing Python and its libraries. The analysis included structured and unstructured numerical as well as textual data.
•Devised a way to estimate the impact of marketing to revenue, while abiding with business rules. Designed an optimum marketing strategybased on the analysisto maximize profits.
•Refined Programming and Data Science skills, while also participating in project planning and client meetings to get consulting experience.

experience.name: Nokia Networks
experience.description:
•Used Machine Learning techniques for Unsupervised Classification and Diagnosis of network related faults.
•Oversaw project end-to-end, involving not only the core ML analysis but also developing a Python based front end to present the same.

projectData.name: Localization and Damage Level Prediction
projectData.description:
•The problem statement was to localize buildings in satellite images, and predict quality of damage to each building provided image before and after a certain natural disaster. To summarize, it is an Instance Segmentation task with high class imbalance.
•After implementing baseline state-of-art algorithms (Mask RCNN, Spacenet), the performance was improved by approaching the labelling problem as a comparative task instead of classification and utilizing Siamese networks. A mask RCNN based on a 6-channel input image was also implemented.

projectData.name: Smart Recommendation system with model interpretation
projectData.description:
•Implemented a robust and generalized recommendation system framework, which can perform with data across text, image and market, while also countering the cold start problem.
•Designed a system for model interpretation and explainability using Python implementations of LIME and SHAP algorithms, this way the prediction had a value not only for recommendations but also in guiding business startegy.

journeySteps.heading: 2014 - college freshman year and C++
journeySteps.description: Freshman year of college in Electrical Engineering at IIT Roorkee. Learnt basics of programming and C++ from a fantastic professor, and tried dabbling with Robotics and electric cars.

journeySteps.heading: 2015 - Sophomore Year, more Robotics and exploration
journeySteps.description: I was still dedicated to being a core Engineer for most part. While still dabbling with some Robotics projects(and winning a few prizes), I came accross a battery mangament based project and started hearing about a certain buzzword - Data Science.

journeySteps.heading: 2016 - Junior Year. Had an affair with Machine Learning, which tuned into a relationship, consequently had to break up with Electrical Engineering. It was 'mutual'
journeySteps.description: After some frustration with engineering and facing some walls, I decided to have an open mind and expand my horizons. While randomly applying for interesting internships, came accross a startup who were engaged in some amazing Deep Learning work. The founder, aware of my enthusiasm depsite noob level knowledge, introduced me to some amazing MOOCs and projects.

journeySteps.heading: 2017 - Internship and building a career in DS
journeySteps.description: After successfully building some preliminary ML skills, applied to a bunch of internships and tried out various projects. Some senior dudes at Tech Mahindra caught wind of my journey and offered to collaborate on an academic project by providing internal data. Also took some advanced MOOCs and discovered Analytics is just a small piece of Data Science and was introduced to the marvelous world of Deep Learning.

journeySteps.heading: 2018 - Full time job and some reflections
journeySteps.description: From a noob to a top 2% hackathon recruit, the Data Science gig had really worked out for me. But I soon discovered that it is my thirst for learning new things so as to solve insolvable problems ,constantly which truly motivated me, not just applause and career opportunities. 'Travel West, young Pranav, there are yet many more lessons to be learnt',a well wisher told me. And so I did.

journeySteps.heading: Fall 2019 - Started Masters at Indiana University
journeySteps.description: Started my Masters at one of the very few universities offering an MS selectively in Data Science. More hackathons and more fun projects.
